    boolean
    canInsertCardOfLevel​(int level, int pile)
    tells you if you can insert a card of level "level" or not (because there is no space), in the pile selected. level must be between 1 and 3 and pile between 0 and 2.

    containsTypeLevel​(CardType cardType, int level)
    this method tells you if the personal board contains a card of a certain type and level.

      constructor

  • Method Details

    • getNumberOfCards

      public int getNumberOfCards()
      Returns:
      the number of cards in the personal card board

    • canInsertCardOfLevel

      public boolean canInsertCardOfLevel​(int level, int pile)
      tells you if you can insert a card of level "level" or not (because there is no space), in the pile selected. level must be between 1 and 3 and pile between 0 and 2.

    • getCard

      public DevelopmentCard getCard​(int pile, int depth)
      Method getCard takes a int i between 0 and 2 to select one of the three pile of owned cards, and a int j (between 0 and the size of the pile -1) and returns the owned development card in that position
      Parameters:
      pile - it's the number of the pile you want to select (0,1,2)
      depth - it's the number of the card you want to select in that pile
      Returns:
      the card in that postion

    • getUpperCard

      public DevelopmentCard getUpperCard​(int pile)
      Method getUpperCard takes a int i between 0 and 2 to select one of the three pile of owned cards, and returns the card on top of that pile
      Parameters:
      pile - it's the number of the pile you want to select (0,1,2)
      Returns:
      the card on top of the selected pile

    • addCard

      public void addCard​(DevelopmentCard card, int pile) throws InvalidCardInsertionException
      Method addCard takes a int i between 0 and 2 to select one of the three pile of owned cards, and add a card on top of that pile. It checks that the insertion in that pile respects the rules of the game (level 2 on level 1 ecc), and if the insertion is invalid it throws an exception.
      Parameters:
      pile - it's the number of the pile you want to select (0,1,2)
      card - is the card you want to add
      Throws:
      InvalidCardInsertionException

    • isCardPileEmpty

      public boolean isCardPileEmpty​(int pile)

    • getReqResProduction

      public Map<Resource,​Integer> getReqResProduction​(List<Integer> activatedProductions) throws IllegalArgumentException
      you give to this method a list in which you say the positions of the card you want to activate for the production, and it returns the required resources for that production. Example: if you want to activate the production for cards in position 0 and 2 you have to pass a list =(0,2)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • getProductionResources

      public Map<Resource,​Integer> getProductionResources​(List<Integer> activatedProductions) throws IllegalArgumentException
      you give to this method a list in which you say the positions of the card you want to activate for the production, and it returns the produced resources of that production. Example: if you want to activate the production for cards in position 0 and 2 you have to pass a list =(0,2) NB: it doesn't return the produced faith points
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • getProductionFP

      public int getProductionFP​(List<Integer> activatedProductions) throws IllegalArgumentException
      you give to this method a list in which you say the positions of the card you want to activate for the production, and it returns the produced faith points of that production. Example: if you want to activate the production for cards in position 0 and 2 you have to pass a list =(0,2)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • getCardsType

      public Map<CardType,​Integer> getCardsType()
      this method returns a map with how many cards of each type there are in this personal card board.

    • containsTypeLevel

      public boolean containsTypeLevel​(CardType cardType, int level)
      this method tells you if the personal board contains a card of a certain type and level.
